intro: Bonamia linearis, commonly known as the narrowleaf bonamia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves. Bonamia linearis is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
